content:
As an AI language model, I do not observe or have direct access to real-world events or social media platforms to track how fans interact with the team. However, generally speaking, there could be a difference in the way fans interact with the team on different social media platforms.

For instance, Twitter users often interact with the team by tweeting about the matches, posting comments, and using hashtags related to the team. Facebook users, on the other hand, might interact with the team through liking their posts, leaving comments, and sharing their content with their friends.

Instagram might be the preferred platform for fans to share images and videos, while TikTok could be an excellent platform for creating short dance or cheer videos. Therefore, the style of interaction and the types of content shared could vary by platform.

Moreover, the tone of the interaction might also vary depending on the platform. For instance, Twitter users are known for creating memes or using a sarcastic tone, while Instagram users might use a more positive and celebratory tone.

Overall, the way fans interact with the team on different social media platforms is likely to vary. Still, the general trend is that social media has made it easier for fans to connect with their favorite team and players directly and express their passion for the team in new and exciting ways.
